artist: after John James Audubon; Lithographer: John T. Bowen
creditline:
The Minnich Collection
The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund, 1966
portfolio: The Viviparous Quadrupeds of North America, Philadelphia, 1845-48
provenance: Dwight and Helen Minnich, Minneapolis; sold to MIA, 1966.
text: Late in life, naturalist John James Audubon made a final expedition to the western plains in search of four-footed mammals. These striped ground squirrels would be tempting prey for many birds, especially hawks and owls. After the squirrels had left, burrowing owls might take over their underground dens.
title: Leopard Spermophile, Male and Female
